info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 11 at 2:49PM MDT until June 11 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Billings MT
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Montana, including the following county, northwestern Wheatland.
* WHEN...Until 545 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry drainages. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 249 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mainly rural areas of Northwestern Wheatland County. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. A few roads may be damaged or washed out in places.
In hilly terrain there are low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON
